meanings.definition: A large marine fish found in the North Atlantic
meanings.sent1: The cod swam gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen caught a cod for dinner.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cod refuse to share its seaweed? It was a selfish fish!
meanings.sent4: The cod was a king of the sea, ruling over its underwater kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The silver scales of the cod shimmered under the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: She tried to cod her friend into believing a tall tale.
meanings.sent2: He decided to cod his brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The magician used sleight of hand to cod the audience into thinking the coin disappeared.
meanings.sent4: Her sweet words were meant to cod him into buying the unnecessary gadget.
meanings.sent5: The scammer's promises were designed to cod unsuspecting victims.

meanings.definition: A bag or sack for holding things, especially fish
meanings.sent1: The fisherman carried his catch in a sturdy cod.
meanings.sent2: She packed the fresh cod with ice to keep it cold.
meanings.sent3: The cod was so full of fish that it almost burst at the seams!
meanings.sent4: The cod's handle broke under the weight of the heavy fish.
meanings.sent5: The salty smell of the sea lingered on the old cod.

meanings.sent1: The children played a funny cod on their teacher.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but laugh at the clever cod her friend pulled.
meanings.sent3: The cod about the talking fish had everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: His cod about the flying pig was so absurd, it became legendary.
meanings.sent5: The cod at the party made everyone burst into laughter.
